revised_title: Peter Brian Medawar: A Pioneering Biologist and Immunologist
tldr: Peter Brian Medawar was a renowned biologist and immunologist who made significant contributions to the field of immunology, particularly in the area of transplantation. He discovered the immunological basis of the homograft reaction, the immunologically privileged site, and other key concepts in immunology. Medawar also played a crucial role in the development of organ transplantation and the treatment of autoimmune diseases. In addition to his scientific achievements, he was a popularizer and philosopher of science, known for his wit and insight into the hopes of his audience.
